Ad Text:
We’re looking for a commercially minded energy professional to join a high-performing team working on some of the most impactful clean energy projects in the country. Flexibility to work in Melbourne or Sydney, with outstanding career development pathways in a collaborative, flexible and dynamic environment.

About the role:
You will play a key role in delivering commercially meaningful work that creates an impact in the energy transition, including:

Advise leading renewable energy and battery developers on how to commercialise their projects – including revenue modelling, offtake strategies, and contract structuring.
Run end-to-end offtake processes – from go-to-market strategy through to final negotiation of binding agreements with major energy buyers.
Contribute to strategic client projects across power and carbon markets, with opportunities to shape advice delivered to C-suite stakeholders and investment committees.
Collaborate with experienced consultants and market experts to deliver impactful results while growing your own technical and commercial skill set.
Work across multiple fast-paced projects, developing core skills in project management, stakeholder engagement, and commercial analysis.
At mid-senior level: Lead client relationships, originate new projects, and mentor junior team members while shaping the growth of the business.
Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Economics, Engineering, Finance or related study.
3 to 6 years’ experience in the Australian energy market (NEM and enviro/carbon markets experience).
Strong understanding of the NEM, and hands-on experience supporting renewable or battery storage projects through development and commercialisation.
Familiarity with offtake contracting, market risk, and revenue strategy.
Proven ability to deliver high-quality work to deadlines in a client-facing environment.
Clear communicator with strong commercial instincts and stakeholder confidence.
Consulting, advisory or trading experience is regarded but not essential.
Benefits:
You’ll work with a team of market leaders, policy experts, and innovators committed to driving real decarbonisation impact. With strong pipeline of work and offices in Melbourne and Sydney, this leading energy business offers a rich learning environment and a purpose-driven culture that rewards initiative and results.

If you are interested to explore this opportunity, apply for the job with your updated CV or get in touch with geoffrey.fabregat@acrworld.com for a confidential discussion.

Senior Business Analyst

6 months contract + 6 months extension option
Australian Citizens with current Baseline clearance
ACT, QLD – Hybrid
Our esteemed Federal Govt. client is seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst to assist in a project to implement an off-the-shelf program and project management and reporting tool within the department to improve the management and reporting of its programs and projects.

In this role, as the Senior Business Analyst you will undertake research, discovery and analysis of business requirements, to scope, design and implement an online Program and Project Management and Reporting Tool (PPMRT).

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Review current project management processes, reporting, and frameworks.
Engage with stakeholders, such as project managers, business owners, senior responsible officers, etc., to gather and validate functional and non-functional requirements from a project perspective.
Document current and future state workflows to inform system design and change planning.
Develop a Business Requirements document, including functional and non-functional specifications.
Support the development of a Project Management Plan (PMP) by aligning requirements with delivery scope.
Facilitate communication between technical teams and business stakeholders, ensuring mutual understanding and agreement.
Produce relevant artefacts and actively participate (and at times lead) in stakeholder workshops, meetings, and stakeholder sessions.
Evaluate existing internal systems for potential use in initiative tracking, including hybrid options.
Technical Skills:

People-centred product design
Strong written communication
Interpersonal skills
Problem solving and solution-based thinking
Business analysis and requirements gathering
Research and discovery Product based development
Process mapping and design
Document and artefact development
User stories and acceptance criteria development
Understanding of APIs and system integrations
Details:
Submission date: 2/11/2025
Duration: 6 months contract
Eligibility: Australian Citizenship with Baseline clearance
Location: ACT, QLD - Hybrid

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, apply now or contact Varsha at our Canberra office on (02) 6257 8888 for more information.

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Business Analyst specialising in Human Capital Management (HCM) to join a highly respected educational organisation based in Melbourne. This role offers the chance to play a pivotal part in a transformative digital programme, supporting the delivery of an ambitious vision for education and technology.

What you'll do:

As a Senior Business Analyst Human Capital Management, you will immerse yourself in understanding how people-related processes operate within a large-scale educational setting. Your days will be filled with engaging stakeholders from various backgrounds-translating their needs into actionable system enhancements that drive efficiency and compliance. You will play an integral role in facilitating workshops, mapping out current processes, identifying gaps or inefficiencies, and collaborating with technical teams to deliver robust solutions.

Conduct comprehensive analysis of existing Human Capital Management processes, systems, and data flows to identify areas for improvement and ensure optimal performance.
Gather detailed business requirements from stakeholders across multiple departments, ensuring all perspectives are considered and accurately documented.
Translate complex business requirements into clear technology specifications using user stories and functional documentation suitable for agile sprint cycles.
Facilitate workshops, conduct one-on-one interviews, perform process mapping exercises, and develop user stories to capture both functional and non-functional requirements effectively.

What you bring:

To excel as a Senior Business Analyst Human Capital Management in this environment, you will bring extensive experience navigating complex enterprise settings-ideally within education or similarly regulated sectors. Your background should include hands-on involvement with HCM modules where you have demonstrated your ability to gather nuanced requirements from diverse stakeholder groups.


Deep understanding of business processes related to HCM functions such as payroll, recruitment, onboarding, performance management, or learning & development.
Exceptional documentation skills with an emphasis on developing clear business process maps and functional specifications tailored for diverse audiences.
Advanced analytical abilities enabling you to dissect complex problems and propose practical solutions that enhance accuracy and compliance.
Experience working with leading HCM software or ERP platforms (such as SAP, Oracle, ADP) is highly desirable for this position.

What's next:

Apply today by clicking on the link provided-take the next step towards advancing your career while contributing meaningfully to the future of education.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply, please click apply or email John Riordan at john.riordan@robertwalters.com.au for a confidential discussion.

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Process Analyst to join a highly respected organisation at the forefront of transformation in Melbourne. This role offers you the chance to play a pivotal part in shaping the future of digital change and transformation.


What you'll do:

As a Process Analyst in this influential role based in Melbourne, you will immerse yourself in the heart of digital transformation projects that underpin the strategic direction of one of Australia's largest enterprise organisations. Your day-to-day activities will involve mapping out current business processes alongside designing future state workflows that enable seamless transitions across systems and roles. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders at all levels-facilitating workshops to gather insights, documenting findings using industry-standard methodologies like BPMN, and ensuring every detail aligns with broader organisational strategies.


Create detailed as-is and to-be business processes, system processes, and data flows to support digital transformation initiatives.
Identify inefficiencies, inaccuracies, compliance gaps, and opportunities for improvement within existing processes, raising change requests or updating process artefacts as needed.
Facilitate engaging workshops and stakeholder meetings to elicit business and system process steps while defining future state operating models and end-to-end processes.
Develop clear and accurate business process models using BPMN standards through tools such as Visio or Signavio.

What you bring:

To excel as a Process Analyst in this transformative setting you will bring proven experience from similar roles where you have successfully navigated complex enterprise environments. Your background should include deep familiarity with finance or HR systems alongside advanced skills in BPMN-based modelling tools.


Demonstrated experience as a Process Analyst within transformation programmes involving both as-is and to-be process design in complex enterprise settings.
Strong understanding of finance, payroll or human capital management functions with hands-on experience in HR or finance/payroll systems such as SAP, Oracle, Workday or ADP.
A track record of facilitating workshops and engaging diverse stakeholders to gather requirements and validate proposed changes.
Excellent analytical skills paired with effective problem-solving abilities when addressing process inefficiencies or compliance gaps.

What's next:

If you are ready to make a meaningful difference through your expertise in process analysis while enjoying outstanding support from colleagues who share your passion apply now!

Apply today by clicking on the link provided-your next rewarding career move awaits.




Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply, please click apply or email John Riordan at john.riordan@robertwalters.com.au for a confidential discussion.

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Business Analyst specialising in Finance and Payroll to join a highly respected organisation based in Melbourne. This role offers the chance to play a pivotal part in a major digital transformation programme, supporting finance and payroll projects that will shape the future of the organisation.


What you'll do:

As a Business Analyst Finance and Payroll, your day-to-day activities will involve engaging with diverse stakeholders to understand their operational challenges and aspirations. By leveraging your expertise in finance ERP and payroll HCM systems, you will help design solutions that streamline processes while upholding strict compliance standards.


Collaborate closely with stakeholders from various departments to gather requirements and translate these into detailed functional and technical specifications for finance and payroll systems.
Utilise your deep understanding of finance and payroll toolsets to provide expert guidance during the configuration and implementation of ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and HCM (Human Capital Management) modules.
Support external implementation partners by ensuring system configurations meet business objectives while maintaining alignment with regulatory standards.

What you bring:

To excel as a Business Analyst Finance and Payroll in this transformative role, you will bring substantial hands-on experience navigating complex enterprise environments where finance ERP or payroll HCM implementations are central.


Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst managing end-to-end SDLC implementations within finance ERP or payroll HCM environments-ideally with exposure to SAP product suites.
Comprehensive domain knowledge of finance operations (including general ledger, accounts payable/receivable, invoicing) as well as payroll functions within complex organisations.
Proficiency in data analysis techniques using reporting tools to extract insights that inform decision-making around process improvements.
Hands-on experience working with cloud-based ERP/HCM products; familiarity with modern ways of working such as Agile methodologies including backlog management and sprint planning.

What's next:

If you are ready to make a meaningful impact through your expertise in finance and payroll transformation within an inspiring setting, this is your moment.

Apply today by clicking on the link below!


Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply, please click apply or email John Riordan at john.riordan@robertwalters.com.au for a confidential discussion.

About the client:

We’re partnering with a complex multi-site organisation currently undertaking a business-wide transformation with a renewed focus on data-driven decision-making. Following the rollout of a Salesforce CRM system across the organisation in 2024, this $200m-$300m revenue business has just appointed a new commercially focused CFO, this is a pivotal time to join. The environment is dynamic and the kind of place where finance professionals can make a real impact.

About the role:

Reporting directly to the CFO, this role sits at the centre of performance analysis and board reporting. You’ll be responsible for identifying key issues and variances, working with divisional business partners to build budgets from the ground up, and delivering the insights that drive better financial outcomes and accountability.

Your work will include:

Owning the monthly board reporting pack and variance analysis
Leading fortnightly and monthly payroll and labour cost analysis
Building and managing the group budget, 3-way model and rolling forecast
Developing and maintaining financial models to support corporate-level strategic planning
Monitoring KPIs and performance across multiple sites, identifying trends and risks
Driving continuous improvement across budgeting, forecasting, and reporting processes
You’ll work closely with a team of Finance Business Partners who support individual business units, while your focus remains on the group-level performance and leadership team.
 
About You:
You’re an analytical thinker who enjoys turning numbers into insight. You’re comfortable in fast-paced team that is going through a period of transformation, can spot what’s wrong before others see it, and have the curiosity to dig deeper.

Background in FP&A, management reporting, or analytical finance within a large or multi-site organisation
Strong financial modelling and Excel capability
Confident in building budgets, forecasts, and interacting senior leaders
CA/CPA qualified
Sector agnostic but experience in turnaround or transformation environments will be highly regarded
What’s on offer:

This is an excellent opportunity to grow under a capable and forward thinking CFO. You’ll play a key role in shaping the group’s financial insights during a period of transformation and be well-positioned to take on broader responsibilities as the business evolves.

Salary circa $160k + Super + on site car parking + benefits
Two days per week WFH
Ownership of board-level reporting and input into strategic decision-making

Company description:



Department of Communities and Justice



Job description:



Business Intelligence Developer

Location: Parramatta with flexibility to work from office locations around NSW (50% office attendance)
Ongoing Full-time opportunity (35 hours per week)
Clerk Grade 11/12 - Salary $149,739 to $173,174 + superannuation and leave loading

Your role

This exciting opportunity is to join the Housing Policy and Strategy Division as a Principal Business Intelligence Developer. This role will demand a variety of complex data modelling, warehousing, and analytics activities to help grow the organization's data and analytics capabilities. It will centre around data analysis and reporting to support strategy and decision-making while leaning on collaboration with stakeholders at various levels to make sure solutions meet business needs.

What you'll do

As part of the System Insights Team, you will take a front and center role in supporting and improving the data and analytics capability of the organization. You will contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of high-quality BI solutions. You will tackle complex data analysis and data visualisation tasks to support strategies and policy initiatives for the management of social housing.

You will be challenged to build and strengthen business intelligence in a diverse and complex environment, where political and social sensitivity is key. You'll need to ensure effective knowledge transfer when communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences and manage negotiations with stakeholders at a senior level.

What we're looking for

This role operates with significant autonomy in consultation with the Manager and within the context of the role and project priorities, so will require someone with great self-management and accountability for the content, accuracy, validity and integrity of their work.

The ideal candidate will also have:

Extensive experience developing complex solutions using Qlik Sense
A strong understanding of ETL techniques with demonstrated experience in management and timely delivery of complex and specialized data modelling and analytic
Proven ability to engage and collaborate effectively with at a senior level and develop productive relationships with team members

For more information about this position, please click here to download the role description.

Overview
We’re looking for an experienced Process Improvement Specialist who thrives in collaborative environments and takes pride in designing streamlined, intelligent business processes that empower teams to work more effectively.

In this role, you’ll work closely with Business Analysts and key stakeholders to co-create the organisation’s future-state processes. You’ll play a central role in shaping efficient frameworks that form the foundation for business requirements and continuous improvement initiatives.

Key Responsibilities
Partner with Business Analysts to design and document ‘to-be’ processes that drive clarity and alignment across teams.
Build detailed process models and frameworks that support requirement development and solution design.
Collaborate continuously as requirements evolve, ensuring processes remain accurate and practical.
Foster strong partnerships across business and technology teams, ensuring roles complement one another.
Skills & Experience
Deep understanding of Lean principles and process optimisation.
High proficiency in BPMN methodology (Signavio experience is beneficial but not essential).
Strong analytical thinking, with the ability to translate complex workflows into clear, logical models.
Exposure to Lean Six Sigma principles (Black Belt certification is advantageous but not required).
You’ll Be Someone Who
Is adaptable, approachable, and collaborative in how you work.
Balances ownership with humility, creating space for others to contribute.
Is a critical thinker with excellent listening skills and self-awareness.
Brings insight and intelligence to every interaction — and values a strong cultural fit as much as technical expertise.
This role suits someone who enjoys facilitating clarity from complexity — an individual who can guide, support, and enable teams to deliver their best work through well-defined processes.

If this sounds like you, please apply within or send your updated CV to chris.selvage@mtr.com.au

Ad Text:
Manager, Business Intelligence

Full time, permanent role
Geelong office location, with flexible hybrid working (3 days a week office attendance required)
Offering a competitive base salary of $163,604 plus super and benefits

Care in Action

With a career in IT Shared Solutions (ITSS), you’ll be part of two organisations with an important purpose for the Victorian community; to look out for the lives of everyone who travels on Victoria’s roads, as well as reducing workplace harm and improving outcomes for injured workers.

Find out more about our shared purpose, and what drives every one of us.

Right now, we’re seeking a Manager, Business Intelligence who will play their part in the shared purposes. Someone with the right skills and expertise, as well as attitude and openness to new ideas, that help advance positive outcomes for the organisations, their colleagues, and themselves.

Two organisations. One IT division.

This role is for a position in the IT Shared Solutions (ITSS) division. A collaboration area in which the TAC and WorkSafe Victoria share resources to deliver IT solutions. If successful in your application, you will be employed by WorkSafe Victoria working across both organisations

About the role

The Manager Business Intelligence is responsible for leading a team of technical specialists to maintain, enhance and support a range of data, analytics, ETL, business intelligence and reporting platforms, products and services. The role is responsible for ensuring the platforms, products and service are delivered to agreed service levels and performing well, while remaining current and secure. Underpinning this is the requirement to establish and maintain policies, principles and pattern, extending when required.

The manager will provide technical leadership and direction to development squads and support teams to ensure that changes do not impact the availability, performance or security of the platform, products and services.

The manager supports, coaches and mentors the team of technical specialists while balancing resources across development and support activities. Responsibilities also include lifecycle management activities, continuous improvement initiatives and support. 

This role requires strong stakeholder management and collaboration with IT stakeholders and delivery partners to ensure operational and strategic needs are met. 

What we’re looking for

Significant experience in a similar role including substantial IT systems management and industry experience

Experience recognising and exploiting business opportunities provided by integration and monitoring technologies to deliver strategically aligned solutions to business priorities.

Demonstrated experience leading high performing teams

Previous experience mentoring and coaching team members through all stages of career and personal development.

Highly developed interpersonal and verbal communication skills

Strong customer focus and ability to understand issues, manage expectations, gain agreement, resolve conflicts and translate technical information into business language as well as excellent influencing and negotiation skills, and the ability to adapt these to a diverse range of stakeholders and contexts.

Significant IT Systems management including:

Extensive experience in application support and lifecycle management and software development lifecycle methodologies, tools and systems, including but not limited to: ITIL, DevOps, Agile, Scrum, Continuous Delivery and/or Rapid Application Development.
Extensive experience with different data, analytics, ETL, business intelligence and reporting technologies and products, such as SAS, Splunk, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau, Snowflake, Azure Synapse, Data Bricks, Informatics, DataStage, AWS Glue, Qlik Replicate

Why you’ll love it here

There’s more to work than a competitive salary and amazing employee benefits. As our newest Manager, Business Intelligence, you’ll also:

Grow your way

Development programs and incentive plans to help advance your career and influence meaningful change.

Be at your best

Wellbeing initiatives, including discounted Gym & Pool Memberships and flexible working arrangements, to support you in being the best you can be.

Achieve, together

We’re a collaborative and empathetic workplace. Work alongside your team to make a truly positive difference to people’s lives.

Ready to put care in action? We’d like to hear from you.

Click apply to submit your Cover Letter and Resume. If successful, you’ll progress to an interview. All applicants will be advised of the outcome of their application.

For more information, read the attached Position Description or contact Tamika Russell, Shared Services Specialist via email: tamika_russell@tac.vic.gov.au for a confidential discussion. Applications for this role will be accepted up until 11:55pm on Monday 10th November 2025.

If we can do anything to help make applying for this role easier, please let our People, Culture & Engagement Team know at People_Culture_Engagement@tac.vic.gov.au. If over the phone is better for you, our number is 5225 7500.

A safe place to work

We’re committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of employees. This extends to inclusion, diversity and accessibility in our employment practices. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, men, women and gender diverse people, culturally diverse and LGBTIQA+ people to apply for our roles.

Child Safety

At the TAC we are committed to the safety of children and young people. For more information regarding our commitment to child safety, please visit our website.

Senior Process Analyst - As-Is Discovery

Location: Melbourne CBD (3 Days Onsite Mandate) Engagement: 6-Month Contract Sector: Leading Enterprise Organisation

The Opportunity

Join a major enterprise business in the Melbourne CBD to kickstart a critical operational transformation program. This is a foundational, high-visibility contract role focused exclusively on deep-dive process mapping and analysis. We are seeking a diligent and expert Process Analyst whose immediate remit is to accurately and thoroughly document the current state ("As-Is") of key business processes.

This is a pure analysis role-we need a dedicated expert to establish the baseline before target-state ("To-Be") design begins.

Role Focus: Dedicated As-Is Analysis

You will be responsible for providing the necessary foundation for future design and change. Your responsibilities will center on rigorous documentation and validation:

Process Elicitation: Conduct in-depth workshops, interviews, and observations with business unit leaders and subject matter experts (SMEs) to gather detailed process steps, inputs, outputs, and pain points.

As-Is Documentation: Create clear, standardised, and high-quality process maps (UML, BPMN, or Swimlane diagrams) that accurately reflect how the business currently operates.

Contextual Analysis: Document key process metrics, supporting systems, data dependencies, and existing control points to provide a holistic view of the current operational environment.

Gap Identification: Highlight initial inefficiencies, bottlenecks, redundancies, and control weaknesses within the documented "As-Is" processes.

Stakeholder Validation: Socialise and validate documented processes with stakeholders at all levels to ensure accuracy and consensus on the current state baseline.

Required Skills & Experience

Proven Experience: Demonstrated track record as a Senior Process Analyst managing large-scale, complex "As-Is" documentation projects.

Process Modelling Mastery: Expert proficiency in process mapping methodologies and tools (e.g., BPMN 2.0, Visio, Lucidchart, Aris).

Stakeholder Engagement: Exceptional communication and workshop facilitation skills, with the ability to manage complex, multi-functional stakeholder groups.

Attention to Detail: Meticulous approach to documentation and data gathering, capable of working independently to meet project deadlines.

Hybrid Work Readiness: Must be comfortable working from the Melbourne CBD office 3 days per week to ensure maximum effectiveness in process observation and workshop facilitation.

Ad Text:
An exciting opportunity exists for an experienced Data Engineering Senior Specialist to join a high-performing data team working on large-scale enterprise initiatives within a modern Azure environment. This role offers the chance to design and optimise end-to-end data solutions that directly support strategic decision-making and business performance.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the design, development, and optimisation of scalable data pipelines using Azure Databricks (data processing and transformation platform) and Azure Synapse Analytics
Build and enhance ETL workflows using Azure Logic Apps (workflow automation and integration tool) and Azure Data Factory
Develop and maintain production-grade code in Python, Spark SQL, and PySpark
Manage data ingestion, transformation, and storage within Azure Data Lake
Collaborate with engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to deliver accurate, well-governed datasets
Contribute to enterprise data architecture, governance, and optimisation best practices
Skills & Experience Required:

Strong proficiency in SQL and Python
Proven hands-on experience with Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Logic Apps
Solid understanding of Azure cloud data services, including Data Factory, Data Lake, and related integration components
Experience building and deploying scalable data pipelines using Spark SQL or PySpark
Strong communication skills and a proactive, dependable attitude
Why Apply:

Join a collaborative and forward-thinking data team
Work with the latest Azure data technologies and engineering practices
Contribute to enterprise-wide transformation projects that drive business insight and innovation

Are you a systems-savvy professional with a passion for driving operational excellence across HR and Payroll platforms? This is your opportunity to join a global mining leader undergoing exciting transformation, where your technical expertise will directly impact payroll accuracy, compliance, and data integrity across a complex, multinational workforce.

This role sits within a forward-thinking Transformation, People & Brand team, where technology meets operational know-how. You’ll collaborate with internal stakeholders and external vendors to ensure seamless data flows, robust system performance, and continuous improvement across HR and Payroll systems.

Responsibilities Include
Maintain and configure Oracle HCM and Payroll systems to ensure data accuracy and compliance
Provide technical support for system integrations and enhancements
Deliver high-quality reporting and analytics to support Payroll, HR, and business teams
Lead data migration efforts for new system implementations
Collaborate with Finance, HR, IT, and external vendors to resolve technical and compliance issues
Drive remediation of system and process issues impacting payroll outcomes
Manage change requests, vendor coordination, and payroll forecasting/reporting
Experience Required
5+ years’ experience supporting Payroll and HR systems in complex organisations
Expertise in Oracle HCM and Preceda Payroll (or similar platforms)
Expertise in Dayforce is highly regarded
Strong understanding of system integrations and data flows
Advanced Excel and Power Query skills for data analysis and reporting
Proven experience in system implementations and data migrations
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
Relevant qualifications in HR, Payroll Systems, IT, or related fields (technical/analytical degree highly regarded)
A proactive mindset with the ability to work independently and collaboratively
What’s On Offer
Inclusive, values-led culture focused on innovation and continuous improvement
Career development and technical training opportunities
Access to cutting-edge technology and global collaboration
Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package

This is more than just a systems role—it’s a chance to be part of a global transformation journey in sustainable mining. If you’re ready to make your mark and grow your career in a supportive, forward-thinking environment, we’d love to hear from you.

Please apply by clicking the Apply Now icon.

We’re partnering with a leading organisation undergoing a key Finance and HR system alignment project.
  
They’re seeking an HCM Analyst to support remediation activities across systems, structures, and data - ensuring Finance and HCM remain fully aligned throughout the program.
  
This role would suit someone who thrives in complex environments, understands both Finance and HCM structures, and enjoys untangling data, processes, and dependencies to drive clean, scalable outcomes.
  
Key Responsibilities:

Lead remediation of existing HCM design elements impacted by the Finance integration program.
Review and validate company, cost centre, and location hierarchies to ensure alignment across both Finance and HCM systems.
Assess downstream impacts on approvals, security, and reporting, and develop recommendations or configuration updates as needed.
Collaborate with Finance, HR, and IT teams to resolve data and process discrepancies, ensuring systems remain synchronised.
Provide guidance on change impacts and remediation plans to ensure a smooth transition during implementation.

About You:

Proven experience with HCM systems (Workday preferred, but experience with any enterprise HCM platform highly valued).
Able to configure the Workday platform.
Exposure to Finance structures such as cost centres, legal entities, and organisational hierarchies.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to assess and communicate system impacts clearly.
Comfortable working across HR, Finance, and Technology functions to resolve complex configuration challenges.

The Details:

Contract: 6 month initial contract
Location: Hawthorne, Melbourne
Start: ASAP
Rate: Attractive daily rate aligned to experience level

If you’re ready to dive into a high-impact project and play a key role bridging HR and Finance systems - we’d love to hear from you!

Baseline Security Clearance Required
Canberra, ACT - 3 Days WFH
Leveraging new open data sources and extracting further value from existing data

Our client, a very large Federal Government Organisation, whose focus is on national security, emergency management, boarder control, immigration and multicultural affairs, are seeking the experience of multiple Lead Data Engineers.

Duties of the Lead Data Engineers:

Producing analytical work that is customer focused;
Discovering trends, patterns and stories told by the data, structured and unstructured, and presenting them to stakeholders;
Producing creative data visualizations and intuitive graphics to presenting complex analytics;
Performing data discovery with primary and secondary sources;
Cleaning and pruning data to discard irrelevant information;

Skills and Experience Required:

At least five (5) years previous experience working as a Data Analyst.
Proven demonstrated ability to deal with both business representatives (to negotiate detailed business requirements) and technical personnel (to negotiate detailed technical logic).
Has expert knowledge about the production of a data output, product or service Provides expertise in developing new products or data services to meet evolving requirements, needs and opportunities. Can build the capability of others in the delivery of data outputs, products or services.
Proven demonstrated ability to work independently to perform data discovery / data mapping work.

How to Apply

Please forward your resume to Alex at Recruitment Hive by clicking the Apply button or email your application to info @ RecruitmentHive.com.au. Alternatively you may call Alex on (02) 6299 1006.

JOB ID: AR 656423 LH-04908

Please note: This role closes on 31st October 2025 2pm however Recruitment Hive welcome late applicants to consider for future opportunities.

We Value Diversity

The Recruitment Hive is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer. We recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience and are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. We encourage people with disability, indigenous, veterans and people of all backgrounds and abilities to express their interest in this role

Job Title: Senior Portfolio Analyst - Portfolio Strategy and Resilience
Salary: Great salary plus 14% super and bonus potential
Ad Text:
Are you passionate about investment strategy and portfolio resilience? Australian Retirement Trust is seeking a Senior Portfolio Analyst to join our Portfolio Strategy and Resilience team. This is your chance to take the next bold step in your career and contribute to something truly impactful. 

 

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We’re all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. As a Senior Portfolio Analyst - Portfolio Strategy and Resilience you’ll provide complex analysis and research to support the design and integration of asset class portfolios, helping deliver cohesive, total portfolio outcomes for our members.


You’ll work closely with a dynamic team to design investment strategies and decisions aligned with our members’ best financial interests. Your insights will help shape and contribute to our research, identify emerging portfolio risks, and develop mitigation strategies to maintain resilient portfolios.

 

Day to day, you'll:

Undertake complex research and analysis to support the shaping and implementation of portfolio strategy, delivering actionable recommendations.
Share updates and suggestions about risks in investment options and market trends; assist in preparing materials for meetings and committee presentations.
Validate data and methods used in risk analysis before sharing results.
Create clear and accurate risk reports using tools and internal systems, including dashboards for investment performance.
Analyse future scenarios that could impact investments and explore risk mitigation strategies.
Build, maintain, and improve fit-for-purpose data, models, frameworks, and tools for portfolio management.
Develop and deliver timely, complex reports to support negotiations and foster trust with key external partners.

This role is 12-month max-term/ secondment opportunity. 

📍 Location: Brisbane or Sydney.

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:  

You have relevant tertiary qualifications in finance, investments, economics, or a related discipline.
You bring experience in the investment industry or a relevant domain, with strong knowledge of legislation, regulations, market trends, risk-reward optimisation, and emerging issues.
You’re highly skilled in research and analysis, and you’re able to work independently to deliver valuable insights.
Your written and oral communication skills are well-developed, allowing you to clearly share your findings and recommendations.
You excel at stakeholder management and you’re a true team player who collaborates effectively.
You’re proficient in using relevant systems and tools to support your work.
Your attention to detail ensures accuracy and reliability in everything you do.

Apply online now

Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close COB Wednesday, 5 November 2025. Please include a cover letter with your application.

We don’t want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you’ll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you’ve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us – and recruitment is no different.

Job Title: Lead Data Engineer – AWS / Big Data / Cloud Transformation
Ad Text:
Join a high-performing Data team that’s driving a large-scale transformation program within the banking and financial services industry. This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious and technically strong Data Engineer to play a lead role in shaping a modern, cloud-based data platform.

You’ll be joining a collaborative, forward-thinking environment where innovation, problem-solving, and technology excellence are at the heart of everything they do.

What you’ll be doing As a Lead Data Engineer, you’ll take ownership of major data initiatives, leading a team to modernise and optimise core data pipelines and platforms. You’ll combine strategic thinking with hands-on expertise to deliver scalable, automated, and efficient data solutions leveraging cloud and big data technologies.

Key responsibilities
Lead the design and delivery of end-to-end data engineering solutions across key transformation programs.
Guide and mentor a team of engineers to build efficient, high-quality data pipelines and integrations.
Drive platform optimisation through automation and AI capabilities.
Collaborate with architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to align solutions with strategic data objectives.
What you’ll bring
Deep Big Data and Hadoop experience with strong Spark, Hive, and Presto (or equivalent) skills.
Expert-level SQL, including query tuning and optimisation.
Proven experience implementing ETL/ELT solutions using tools like Talend, DataStage, or Informatica.
Strong AWS experience across EC2, S3, RDS, and EMR.
Sound understanding of data modelling, metadata management, lineage, and data quality frameworks.
Hands-on Python experience, particularly in automation and AI integration.
Why apply You’ll be part of an organisation that values collaboration, innovation, and technical excellence. This is a key leadership opportunity for someone passionate about modern data engineering, automation, and cloud transformation within a leading financial institution.

Guidewire Claims Center Program. Financial Services Client. Competitive Rate. 12 month initial contract.

Your new company

Join a leading consultancy supporting a reputable insurance organisation embarking on a major cloud upgrade of their Guidewire Claims Center platform. With confirmed funding and a strong delivery roadmap, this organisation is scaling up its business analysis and engineering capability to support a multi-year transformation.

Your new role


As a Business Analyst, you'll play a key role in the Guidewire upgrade project, specifically focused on Claims Center (not Policy or Billing). You'll work across integration capability, data migration, and system understanding, contributing to a technically functional team during the discovery phase and beyond.


Your Responsibilities

Collaborate with engineers and stakeholders to support the upgrade of Guidewire Claims Center to cloud
Analyse and document integration and data migration requirements
Work closely with vendors and internal teams to ensure alignment across deliverables
Provide insights into system functionality and support testing and validation activities
Attend onsite meetings with delivery partners and internal stakeholders as required

What you'll need to succeed


Minimum 2 years of recent experience (within the last 3 years) as a Business Analyst on Guidewire Claims Center projects
Strong understanding of integration and data migration in insurance platforms
Technofunctional skillset with the ability to bridge business and technical teams
Excellent stakeholder engagement and documentation skills
Able to go into Sydney based office 3 days per week

What you'll get in return

Competitive rate, long term contract, hybrid working.

What you need to do now




If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Role type: Full-time; Continuing
Faculty: Chief Operating Officer Portfolio
Department/ School: Operational Performance Group
Salary: UOM 10 $153,412 p.a. plus 17% super (Please note: Compensation rates will be updated as of November 1, 2025).

Drive cutting-edge data platform development / Shape university-wide analytics capabilities / Lead cloud-based data innovation
Apply now to spearhead data engineering excellence and transform analytics capabilities at a world-class university
Investing in you - benefits package including salary packaging, health and wellbeing programs, discounted services, and professional development opportunities.


The University of Melbourne
We take pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research. Discover more via our website.

Your next career opportunity
As the Data Engineering and Analytics Manager at the University of Melbourne, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the institution's data future. You'll lead the development and support of the Enterprise Data Lake (AWS) and Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) platforms, turning data models into robust operational outcomes that enable enterprise reporting and analytics. This role offers you the opportunity to drive innovation in cloud-based data solutions, lead a high-performing team, and directly impact the university's data-driven decision-making capabilities.

Your responsibilities will include:

Platform Leadership: Provide direction and oversight for the Snowflake data warehouse and AWS data lake architecture, ensuring alignment with organisational goals.

Team Management: Lead and develop a team of data engineers and analytical analysts, fostering a high-performing, collaborative culture.

Data Pipeline Development: Oversee the creation of scalable, secure data pipelines, ensuring efficient data movement, transformation, and governance.

Innovation: Drive the evolution of data engineering and data science practices, embedding best practices in automation, security, and performance.

You may be a great fit if:
You are an experienced data leader with a strong technical background in data engineering and warehousing, possessing excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to drive innovation in complex, enterprise-scale data environments.

You may also:

Hold a Bachelor's or Post Graduate degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.

Have proven leadership experience in managing data engineering and data science teams, preferably in AWS or Snowflake environments.

Demonstrate deep understanding of data governance, security, and compliance in cloud environments.

Possess strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage effectively with diverse stakeholders.

Show a commitment to mentoring and developing team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.


For further information please refer to the attached PD.

What we offer you!
We offer the opportunity to be part of a vibrant community and enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits to support your success and sense of fulfilment, including:

Supportive flexible work arrangements underpinned by our commitment to inclusion and well-being
Progressive, considerate leave provisions to empower your work-life balance
Salary packaging and access to a range of discounted services including Bupa health insurance
Health and well-being services including a leading Employee Assistance Program


For more information check out our benefits page!

Your new team - Operational Performance Group
The Operational Performance Group delivers functions that facilitate the design, evaluation, and improvement of services across the University, and business partnering services to Chancellery. The OPG brings together a range of cognate business functions and expertise such as Data Governance, Management and Analytics; Business Transformation and Decision Support; Operational and Service Improvement, Service Design, Experience, Culture and Capabilities; Digital Operations; and Business Continuity Planning.

Be Yourself
The University of Melbourne is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a child-safe organisation. We are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and have the opportunity to thrive regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, age, being a parent or having caring responsibilities.

The University of Melbourne is committed to fostering a barrier-free and inclusive recruitment process. We are dedicated to providing reasonable adjustments for candidates throughout the application and interview stages, including accessible document formats and alternative application methods.

To discuss your specific requirements, please feel free to contact Kim Groizard - +61 3 9035 3218 or send an email titled 'Reasonable Adjustments' to hr-careers@unimelb.edu.au. You can find more information for applicants requiring reasonable adjustments on our Careers website: https://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers

Find more information for applicants requiring reasonable adjustments.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants
We aspire to be the University of choice for Indigenous Australians. Our Indigenous strategy, Murmuk Djerring outlines our investment and support for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander staff and students.

Indigenous applicants are encouraged to connect with our Indigenous Employment & Development team at oied-hr@unimelb.edu.au for further information and support.


Please note: This role requires current valid work rights for Australia. Visa sponsorship is not available.

A Working with Children Check (WWCC) is required for all positions. If successful, we'll guide you through the WWCC application process during onboarding and reimburse the cost.

Join Us and unlock your career potential!
If this role is right for you, please apply with the following documents:


Resume
Cover Letter outlining your interest and experience
The responses against the Selection Criteria^ (found in the Position Description)

For recruitment queries, please email Mick Powar via hr-careers@unimelb.edu.au. Please Include the Position Number and Job Title in the subject line. Please do not send applications to this email address.

For job-specific queries, refer to the contact details in the Position Description.

Applications close: Sunday 9th November Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST) / Melbourne time zone.
